thread.title: 'Mr. Boys Club' gets court dedicated to him postumously|Mario Generali honored at Steak and Burger Dinner
thread.title_full: 'Mr. Boys Club' gets court dedicated to him postumously|Mario Generali honored at Steak and Burger Dinner

author: ROGER CLEAVELAND REPUBLICAN-AMERICAN
title: 'Mr. Boys Club' gets court dedicated to him postumously|Mario Generali honored at Steak and Burger Dinner
text:
Friday, October 23, 2015 12:30 AM EDT 
'Mr. Boys Club' gets court dedicated to him postumously Mario Generali honored at Steak and Burger Dinner BY ROGER CLEAVELAND REPUBLICAN-AMERICAN The Generali family stands in front of the signature of family patriarch, the late Mario Generali, who was honored with a court dedication Thursday night at the Boys and Girls Clubs of Greater Waterbury. Mario Generali was a club member, part-time worker, program director and executive director for 47 years. Browse for Republican American Reprints WATERBURY â€” When Mario Generali walked into the Waterbury Boys Club for the first time at age 7 in 1931 to join, Norm Feitelson had already been a cash-paying member for two years at a nickel per week.Feitelson, now 91, takes great pride in how his experiences helped shape him as a kid and later as a young adult, but he admits he never met anyone who has done more with their Boys Club roots than the late Generali, who was a member, employee, program director and executive director for a total of 47 years.
